SENT.plain: A Marfan patient presented with a bilobar apical pseudoaneurysm after repeated surgery
These abnormalities were demonstrated by three-dimensional-echo, Doppler, and CT-reconstruction
The pseudoaneurysm was related to an apical venting procedure
In this case, a conservative approach was chosen, although in general, pseudoaneurysms form an indication for operative correction, because of the risk of rupture and acute tamponade
